it my name is Sean NEP I'm the CTO and
co-founder of ouala UA as a a video
technology platform and solutions
company we work with some of the largest
broadcasters Studios and msos and mvpds
around the world we provide technology
to help people like ESPN and Bloomberg
take their video content from
traditional TV and provide it to their
users online we all as customers
leverage our video analytics solution
built on top of the adabs cloud very
extensively to inform a lot of their
business decisions around how they
create content how they distribute it
and ultimately how they monetize their
video content we Alla makes very heavy
use of three Amazon web services first
and foremost we leverage ec2 extensively
we leverage ec2 in a large number of
regions uh we run uh multi availability
zones in every single region and we use
a large number of instance types
everywhere down to the micro siiz
instances all the way up to uh some of
the large cluster compute instances we
also make really heavy usage of spot
instances uh surging anywhere from
hundreds to even thousands on on a daily
basis uh to do things like video trans
coding second we leverage S3 for a lot
of our storage this is everything from
log storage to video file storage uh to
random other uh corporate file storage
for example we also leverage Glacier uh
as our cold storage and backup system
for pretty much every file that a
customer ever sends to ell between S3
and Glacier uh we store about 1 to 1 and
a half pedabytes of data obviously we
use S3 for a lot of our hot storage uh
and Glacier for quite a bit of our Cold
Storage lastly we leverage Cloud front
for delivery of our files primarily for
video files uh that flow through ec2 uh
for our transcoding we then store them
in S3 and use cloudfront to deliver them
out to the end user some of the largest
constraints that have been removed by
you leveraging AWS has been the ability
to quickly iterate uh and put product in
Market without having to plan far out
ahead because often times we don't know
uh how successful a product or a feature
will be some of the the biggest
advantages of working with AWS has been
access
to pretty much unbounded levels of
capacity uh from a compute and a storage
perspective uh we've been able to Surge
our infrastructure to 3 4 5x the overall
size uh in a matter of hours to quickly
scale in response to our customers needs
with AWS we've been able to radically
accelerate our overall rate Innovation
we've been able to build product faster
uh test it out in Market and ultimately
scale it for our customers at a pace
that just simply wouldn't have been
possible if we were to build uh our own
infrastructure
